LSv3I7DHRjkRketpHEj5Zg.text: Just spent a week in London (Marble Arch area). By far the best and most authentic pub we ventured in to.   Great food, good beer and very friendly staff.  It's well worth the trip.   We'll be back as we "cross the pond" again

KjTgI_1zwN2LhZcngJ8ZSg.text: This place is excellent.  It nested at corner of Hyde Park Square and Strathearn.  Looks like a neighborhood place.  OMG, what a find off Yelp.  Food is excellent and everything comes at timely manner.  Our servers are so attentive and run up and down in speedy Gonzales style.  Great men.  Drinks came right away, ice cold and perfect .  Food came hot and delicious.  Tap is reasonable.  This is THE Place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Delicious Rabbit Terrine with fennel salad.  Oh mine, YES, the mini sausages.  Life just doesn't get any better than this
Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Grilled lamb with pomegranate and Feta Cheese
Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Came perfect!  English Onion Soup easy on Cheddar and my beloved Scotch Egg

NY1hKzFNUAKjikRhwYLiig.text: This pub has THE BEST customer service I've experienced at the pub scene in London.  The pub is adorable, and is in a great location near Paddington.  Their menu is small, but the food was pretty good.  Honestly, nothing too special with the beer, but the bar staff was so friendly and fun - I'd go back just for that!

Aekb6jluvcSj8_JFXr91Rg.text: Great spot for lunch and a few pints. Food was spot on and service excellent at the bar

R1jeJAyigw9vXo5B-1cSaw.text: The Victoria Pub is my favorite spot to stop in London.  The food is outstanding, the staff is amazing and the atmosphere is so welcoming.  Chris is one of the nicest people I've met and is great with suggestions for what to order.  Check out Tuesday Trivia night for a fun night out!

_xqnar_oOwm-5ZiUUj36zg.text: Not as good as other pubs we had been too by Westminster Bridge.  Fish and Chips and Burger were okay for food and wine and beer as okay as well.  Wouldn't come back here or recommend.

sS8IOdHtx4RlhRtR9fwqCQ.text: Arrived from Heathrow in the afternoon and after walking through part of Hyde Park went here based on the reviews. We weren't disappointed. Good selection of ales and the bartender gave me a sample to try before ordering. The food was good, particularly the shepherds pie. I couldn't finish it. Great atmosphere also. Not a lot of seating though so had to scramble to find a table just for the two of us.

sC2tRJsk5j7YyYSDhA0ZjQ.text: Very good fish and chips. Not oily like in most places, fish was tasty, and fries were crispy

HrKwRAzhvJRAo-fy5jTduA.text: Was an hour early to meet a friend at Paddington Station, so decided to squeeze in a quick pint. There were plenty of places closer to the station, but they were pretty touristy and looked a little crap for the want of a better word. Found this place only about 5 minutes walk from the station, really had a homely and local feel, staff were all friendly and chatty as I sat at the bar alone.Plenty of people were eating, so I presume the food is, I reckon I will be back one day to find out.

ayqoiNk9wvTRWa-aq_Cu0A.text: Great pub with excellent food! The fish and chips are good and so are the pies of the day. Only complaint was that the pork belt was on the dry side. Luckily I had a London Pride to sip on! Was seated in the library and that was a treat in itself.

L3he__XkN1o4CVQzZHkxhQ.text: Don't waste your time with the regular station pubs in Paddington. A five minute walk will get you to this bustling Fullers pub. Great Pride and ESB paired with good food and friendly staff makes it worth the effort. Does get extremely busy and is pretty small. Tables and chairs outside with gas heaters.

M1QP3jiWdDXp2BiJajShlg.text: I love this place. I've been here several times. They have a nice and comfy atmosphere and are far enough off of the beaten path to avoid a tourist crowd. The food is quite good, and they have a good selection of ales, including several real ales. Staff is not as attentive as they could be when things get busy.

RNoGmmQUsFMlHLAHdrTj7A.text: A beautiful pub in a quiet residential street near Paddington station. They offer a good selection of drinks, some decent food that's above average compared to typical pub fare, and a nice atmosphere in which to enjoy a quiet drink. There's an upstairs area too that features a cosy library with a wonderful fireplace, just what the doctor ordered for a cold winter night.Drawbacks? Well it's fairly pricey but standard for London, and err, the men's toilets are tricky to get to down some steep steps especially after you've had a few drinks!

v04M8UKW7v5i7l0_Us72kg.text: The reviews are correct.  Excellent food, service, and atmosphere.We went with a group of four adults and six children.  We ate dinner upstairs in the library and had an amazing and wonderful experience.

hrWZV1JzT0MXaXBMfmlRow.text: Recently ate here whilst on holiday in London.  Had the fish and chips, and I have to say they were the best fish and chips I have ever eaten!!  A really nice friendly London pub and if you are staying in Paddington as I did, definitely worth a trip!

ppiTGV5jsPQFaufy13gO3g.text: First "Official" British Beer in London. I was solo and found a spot at the bar. Ordered a Discovery recommended by the bar tender and chugged it down in no time. By the time I was done with my beer, I was offered a pint of ESB from an old Chap named Nick who had raced in the Daytona races back in the 70's. He was really cheeky and interesting so I joined him and some new friends on the patio outside and later inside upstairs in the library. I had a big Indian dinner and didn't eat here but was amazed at the meat pie's being delivered to near by tables. Later in the night, I really wanted to have some chips and curry aka french fries but the kitchen had closed. Instead my new friends from Sweden and I had crisps aka potato chips and discussed politics, racism in America and other interesting topics. All that was missing was a pipe to smoke like Sherlock Holmes. Ha!Perfect first night in London.

PNzoxFY5CcFlU74ZbB3LLg.text: Solid food.  Not touristy, feels like a local pub, which I think it is.Within walking distance from Paddington Station, so an easy place to grab a bite when come from or going to Heathrow.

gAcYzelxwagDxssHzNQYiw.text: The quintessential London meal didn't fail to deliver here.  Fish and chips was a great choice, and I'm glad I had the dish here.Why a "4" and no higher?  The smashed peas was more like peas purée this evening, and I really wanted to try the toffee pudding as raved about on other posts.....not on the menu tonight.All in all, a very good choice.

9FP_mtGDLcadcAqV1GZEJQ.text: Went here twice on my recent trip to London.  Had an awesome cheese toastie at lunch, so we came back for dinner and did it up with Sunday roast, bangers and mash, and toffee pudding - everything was amazing.  Highly recommended for ambiance, food, and beer/cider selection.A note for Americans - This place surely feels like an "authentic" pub, but I think it must be listed in guidebooks or something because it is crawling with Americans.  If this doesn't bother you, great.  But, if you don't like hearing people talk about New Jersey on your London vacay, then you may want to avoid it.

8zm5Qs2kacsB926pVDUomA.text: Food was decent but the service was quite horrible with rude and inconsiderate staff. I have no desire to return.

-_Khx4fuifx6-Llg0E6VLg.text: The website says they've won fullers pub of the year a few times and my visit definitely supports that. I went a few times right after I moved to London. Friendly bar staff and an impressive selection of beers with a few taps that rotated. It's a solid mix of locals that the staff knows by name and travellers just visiting.  Very friendly atmosphere and I would gladly recommend to anyone. Tip- if the bar is full check out the library upstairs!

Mm4KELzT8_qdG46uYXd8zg.text: Totally disappointed with this place. I can't even begin. We were told it's seat yourself, so we sat upstairs in the nice room with the fireplace. The was a party of 5 sitting next to us and another couple across the room and a single person sitting on the couch. Everyone enjoying their food and company. A couple of minutes go by and no service. Ok no big deal. I went downstairs to see if we order from the bar and was told that someone will be with me shortly. She asked if I'm upstairs and I said yes. Minutes past, nothing. Went to go check again. Same thing happen. I noticed a"light switch" next to my table and saw a bell icon on it. So I thought that we might have to ring the bell. I pressed it, some one finally looked their head in the room and for a split second then disappeared after glancing at the large table. Pressed it again. Same thing. The server took a quick glance at the large table and disappeared. Not even looking at us or anyone else for that matter. I don't know but after that we left. It was when we were heading out some one acknowledged us that we were there.... I had enjoyed my time in London until that time

8q2evizRGTtIxamKCa-Glw.text: We chose this restaurant based on The Yelp rating and were very disappointed in the food quality/preparation/service. We were there on a weeknight, but it was very busy and crowded. We weren't acknowledged or greeted so we walked over to the dining area and waited for a small table to be cleared. We tried to wave the server down several times, but she ignored us and avoided eye contact--turns out (I guess) we were supposed to order drinks and food at the bar...at least that is what we ended up doing. That aside: we both ordered fish and chips and what we thought would be "starters" or appetizers. It all came at once. I had been looking forward to the light flakey crust another Yelp user had written about. Instead, our fillets were dark brown with a hardened crust and inside the fish had been well shrunken (due to over cooking) and was very chewy. Regarding appetizers: I enjoyed the scotch egg (my first), but the bowl of mini sausages were nearly tasteless if not for the sauce. On the plus side, it was everything we had hoped to find in terms of the style and atmosphere you hope to find in a British Pub. On a calmer night this may have been a different story, and the harried waitstaff may have been more attentive; however, the poor food quality isn't as easy to forgive. If this review was based on food alone, I would have given it one star.

CZ46d_5tbJCQLEk-bpk7gA.text: While many pubs are well worn and decorated with decades of nostalgic paraphernalia, The Victoria feels a lot more modern/sleek - though still a pub.On approach I was struck by the outdoor flaming decor.  Inside, the bar is certainly the center of attention, with people on 3 sides.  There's also many side tables.  I didn't eat, but the people near me were hungrily devouring their food.What I really liked was the large diversity of ages in the pub.  There seemed to be a very large group of grandfather-aged gents enjoying some special occasion with many rounds of beer.  It's near my hotel and I'll likely be back several times as it's a perfect neighborhood bar.

rlN76f0VeqBvA5seNjfawQ.text: Delightful.  Loved our waiter. Super patient and great service. First night in London was truly memorable. Yummy mezzo plate too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. View out the window of The Victoria. Ready for a great meal. Excellent wait staff. Great first day in London!

LcgZBcU4pomNJ4eVnwPoBw.text: Pie of the day- definitely recommend! And the cider on tap was cold. Friendly staff, nice spot to chill and watch the world go by

nfNam9bflmSo31q8XUgPcA.text: Best pub in London! Seriously! The food is amazing! People are extremely nice and it's a very warm and cozy. I wish I had taken pictures of the food but I was so hungry and everything looked so good that I couldn't resist! Hahaha

s6ekLRy742vp-E84P-CbIg.text: Perfect little place!We spent a few hours here waiting for the Express to take us to Heathrow. (Late flight)It is straight out from Paddington Station, a few blocks. It is worth the extra steps instead if choosing any if the pubs next to the station. Early Monday afternoon it is quiet.What I like best is that they serve Fuller's (ESB being a favourite). I always try to find Fuller's pubs.We had a chicken ciabatta and a salmon on rye - both very good. Super friendly staff.The accept AMEX.

UT0ZBZOBCEUQjkJ3RVajxg.text: We were searching for fish & chips our one night in London, and we found this awesome pub. Seemed a fun, neighborhood kind of place, very friendly. Pints were on the table quickly, and the fish and chips were quite good!

POLGzEdoPNbhMdYDd04d7A.text: Tonight my husband and I were fortunate enough to stumble upon this place. We ordered cider and beer and ordered two delicious dishes for dinner. We finished our perfect meal with the chocolate pudding dessert. Worth the visit most definitely! The best cider I have ever had!

kKqcW1TlYC5lCyEg8OikKQ.text: Great service. Great owner. Cool place.My wife is allergic to nuts/peanuts and they took care of her. Fish&chip was good. 8/10. Chips could be a bit more crips but very good. We order a Pimps drink. Very good. The decor is very nice. Lots of local people. I would go back.

GK31FvQqMOCih5qi13ctMQ.text: Came for the Sunday roast. No complaints. In fact 4 stars - really should give it 5 but I'm sat next to some loud mouth Americans who are droning on and on about how successful they are, where they have visited but no anecdotes, which investments they have, how europe is an 'inefficient capti market' blah blah blah. Get a life ! Talk about some fun things! 1 Star upgrade - the Americans left and 2 elderly French couples sat down. No idea what they are saying but they are drinking and laughing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom

yI9puyCzhbtp-XPCekqbsg.text: Tasty fish and chips with mushy peas. The burger was perfectly cooked, juicy, nice toppings and loaded on a delicious bun that was up to the task of holding it all together.  Friendly service for a fair price. Recommend.

rLLILnzE70HCmp9wJs4SOg.text: Nice location and interior, the farmhouse ice cream was great.  The ESB was cold and tasty, the bartenderesses were reasonably friendly, a good visit all in all.

LcNMYzXSrQYRRzRNSvkUTg.text: We wanted to have traditional British pub food for dinner, so we went to The Victoria and enjoyed the food and ambiance.  You walk in, find a table, and order at the bar.We order the Frontier battered cod, crushed minted peas, chips & tartar sauce - which is huge and delicious.Chalcroft farm beef burger, baby gem, tomato, gherkin, chips, & bacon.And Chicken Caesar salad, bacon, croutons to have something healthier.We also had a London Pride premium ale.The food tasted good and the service was courteous.There's a Theatre dining room and Library dining room upstairs.We loved the casual royal theme feel of the pub.You pay at the bar as well.Total for 3 of us was £38.55

-FFBs-K5jx83Yq4uDt0Efw.text: Great pub food, delicious beer and a gorgeous building make this a perfect choice for a drink, a meal or both. There are over half a dozen beers on top from Fuller's and I can personally recommend the ESB. I had the beer battered cod and was very pleased. The cod was fried golden brown and perfectly crispy. It was even better with a little tarter sauce on top. The mashed and minted peas on the side were a great addition to the meal. I would definitely go back to try more food and draught beers.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. The view from the outside.

iAH7LTc1qxlnATa-1-26Ig.text: The Victoria was an unexpected delight. Going in, I knew I was going to a Pub with good food and that I could rely on (thanks, Yelp!), and I hoped I would be able to hear and have a good conversation with our group of 4 without yelling (because you just never know). We made a reservation, which they are nice enough to take via their website, and were seated upstairs in the "Library Room". The Library Room is everything I love about London: a random, lovely experience in an unexpected place with good food. With a wood burning fire place and bookcase walls, the library room has only 4 tables (giving it an intimate feeling), but the high ceilings make it still feel spacious. Set apart from the main part of the Pub, it was quiet enough for nice conversation and felt like the kind of place you could loiter and socialize over pints or a bottle(s) of wine for ages. (If you want to be the best date-planner ever, book the comfy seat in front of the fire place in the Library Room. The drinks are affordable at the Victoria, and your date will never suspect it because the ambience is so good)The food was above average (top notch for a Pub), though it's definitely not the part I found most memorable. However, (fun fact), when you put black currant in Guinness it makes for a magical, less bitter, thing. You should try it, it's strange and amazing.I really enjoyed the Victoria, and would definitely recommend it (especially for the kind of casual, but intimate dinner we had).

VjJf6pw1hHZ7f-egr0Sl-g.text: You can feel great atmosphere of typical U.K. Pub if you enter in.  Some delicious foods and some kind of beer is waiting for you.

h1cgPNg1HhO8R5aJOHbP8Q.text: The ambiance is amazing - whether you're outside enjoying good weather or inside enjoying the Victoria's charm, you can't lose.the beer selection is really good - I had some organic beer on draft and it was amazing.Food is also fresh and tasty.  I got a lamb/ feta salad and although a little too much cheese (didn't know there was such a thing) the flavors and spices were really great.  fish n chips portion was huge!Why not five stars? The food service was terrible.  None of us got our food at the same time - it was so disparate that one of my friends' meal didn't come until well after mine was finished.  Also, we had issues with the food bill which was a little annoying.  I realize this all could have been a one-off bad day thing but feel it's worth sharing.

RtJnreLlBX5yReha98Mh0g.text: Good food and beer. Full bar even for a weeknight. Was slightly disappointed in the fish and chips as they left the skin on the fish. My husband had the ox cheek which was excellent!  We would return.

PhM2f275UrjNjCm-kuFEbg.text: If you are looking for a classic pub, this is your place. Decent prices and very friendly personnel.

bj072aWd8DU9clMjzUCMoA.text: This pub is actually very good one. Great thing is that they serve food and the food actually is good. Well done, guys.

-m1sGeRuC5lIppfR8Y2xOQ.text: Great to discover this friendly classic Fuller's pub in walking distance of Paddington. Will be my new "quick-drink meet-up-before-catching-train-home" place. Lovely polished wood Victorian interior, and good outside seating (fully used even in October!) and all the beers you would expect.

dwyv7-Mif-KOo55QMy2IOg.text: Without question my favourite pub in London, The Victoria is blessed with a great location (near enough to Paddington to be within a six or seven minute walk of your train); fantastic, unspoilt Victorian decor and fittings; superb, friendly staff; an outstanding beer selection, beautifully looked after; and great food that comes in proper grown-up portions. The only downside I can think of is that the gents' toilet is down in the basement, which can only be accessed by means of the steepest, narrowest staircase I have ever seen. It has to be negotiated sideways - particularly after two or three of the Fullers beers on offer in the bar. But it would be churlish to deduct a star from this wonderful oasis simply for that reason. Outstanding place that everyone should visit.

Hvq3akxcHhwboL76_S9DiA.text: This is the first pub I ever visited in London and it remains my favorite. Its small and cozy and full of locals. I sampled several of Fullers better selections and ended the evening with Steak and Ale Pie and an ESB. You should put this one on your list of cool London pubs. Its only a short walk from the Royal Lancaster Hotel.

6C5dsiXQz_lIgNcHSY0wfQ.text: Simply an excellent pub. The only complaint I would have is that others seem to think so too, and it's sometimes so busy I keep walking to another place. It's a pub you'd be happy to take your parents to, or go to with friends - something of an all-purpose place.

CFXOfwqUDYAKQAPJThemKw.text: Thanks to Peter Grogan for taking me here, and introducing me to a fine pub.  The decor and atmosphere are wonderful.  I had fish and chips for lunch, which came out as a tremendous portion.  I joked that they must have known I was american in the kitchen.  The service and beer selection are good.  What else do you need? I saw an older gentleman reading a book, which is what I would've done without the good company !

irYfS7gEwne9yGxqQE4GmA.text: Excellent food for a pub, and upstairs rooms were a good place to keep a 2-year old in a confined area away from noise!

DXYKiDD9KS67GBYNXwMW4g.text: Lovely pub, a great selection of ales, and great pub fare.  I highly recommend a visit.

jyYQiKt0nAn3ikUNyfzGHw.text: Chiswick bitter, everything on tap ranges from good to excellent. Excellent pub, always a good time.

Zvi-4ImLLuuDpW8KVzf5Ew.text: This is the first pub I ever visited in London and it remains my favorite. Its small and cozy and full of locals. I sampled several of Fullers better selections and ended the evening with Steak and Ale Pie and an ESB. You should put this one on your list of cool London pubs. Its only a short walk from the Royal Lancaster Hotel.

WIPHwwJkcI7e7LyK2x7dAA.text: A great lively pub with good food and awesome service. I had the fish and chips and they were rather good. I came here and met my coworkers around dinner time. We had a great evening and good drinks. I could only give 4 stars, due to the limited drink selection.

fcqbuqIO4wwUeFRnJbXtfw.text: Just lovely. Lovely to look at. Lovely food. Lovely wait staff. Make a reservation because it is popular! The downstairs has etched glass and mirrors behind an old bar and tables to sit with friends. Upstairs are two dinning rooms (also chairs around a fireplace) with an equal amount of charm plus quiet. The varied menu has something for everyone from small plates, snacks, to mains. Delicious Fish & chips too. Enjoy!

1sEHMYF1ka356_r-UOUCCg.text: A lot of the pubs in London are owned by one of a few major pub corporations all serving the same frozen crap reheated,  not here though a real kitchen and a great Sunday roast combined with friendly service!

DuGfMSr3p49EwdSWm8wKVQ.text: We stayed at a hotel around the corner and had evening in the Pub, it was a cold January evening 2017, the fire was roaring, my son ate sausages and mash, he's an American teenager and finished it all and proclaimed it was good, but i wouldn't accept that as an indication of food quality, although it looked very appetizing to me and other than i was having dinner later i would of been happy to order the food, actually i had the Calamari appetizer it was adequate but not outstanding.The place is a Pub and it did that admirably , warm, inviting, happy clientele , non threatening and very comfortable with food available , frankly i loved the ambience and would happily spend another night sipping drinks by the fire, Loved it !

JDqDlb0kSFDAcvdfqjBrrQ.text: Came here for a Sunday roast. A little unorganized upstairs but overall the service was nice and the food was delicious!! Would definitely come here again. I had the Shepherd's pie and my bf had the beef roast. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. !!!

XlrWCGRQBfuELyeWPoB_VA.text: Read the reviews that aren't locals or people wrapped up in the "majesty" of going to an authentic English pub (whatever that is). This was highly recommended by my hotel and they blew it. Service was poor and slow. Food meh. If this is the best, then surely I need to take off my US lens

QoBOWQbZmDziPmeyzOgfgA.text: Very charming! The bartenders were all very pleasant and engaging. This place has a very historical aspect in that it's very old and well established with a long line of key figures as past frequenters. The food was excellent!

xjF_jzgYbyV4G6J_neaeTg.text: A beautiful Georgian building in Hyde Park, with Victorian mirrors and wood details.  The owner is friendly and direct, and we enjoyed the beer and cider he recommended. It is very popular and it has comfortable seating outside.  We did not eat here, but the dishes we saw were hearty and well presented.

7-3qVkBDbl4ZZEY_VNSFEw.text: A very pleasant pub near Paddington! Thanks to the yelpers on the resounding "yes" for this place, it panned out exactly as planned...much appreciated. A cousin of ours had a 6 hour layover at Heathrow, so we all decided to take the opportunity to meet for a late Sunday lunch. Needing something very near Paddington Station for ease, The Victoria seemed undoubtedly the best choice. Right-o, it was indeed. We perched at a comfortable table for a few hours, enjoying a leisurely Sunday with locals and travelers alike. The bar was dotted with folks, as were most of the tables...overflow surely could've taken over the upstairs, which was quite delightful as well (especially for a private party!). The fish 'n chips (my choice) were satisfying and the boys both indulged in pork belly roasts, plates both cleaned if that is any indication. Very nicely done! As is mentioned in many a review...the beer selection is minimal, but passable. Pints for all, and to all a good night. Service was as expected. Not particularly warm, but efficient none the less. Would surely come back if I needed a solid pub in Paddington again...perhaps next time to the upstairs library.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips!

QpFvMCxh1lJKORXw9RrMKg.text: This is truly a pub and you can tell by the people hanging around. It's dark and noisy. We reserved the upper level so we could hear each other. Their food is very good and the service is great. I had duck breast and it was delicious. I had my last Guinness beer and I ended up drinking two since I won't be able to drink a good one until I come back.

oCnMjqflqg43wevxQC0wKQ.text: Not pleased with the food or service during my visit tonight. I ordered the chicken with crisps, garlic mayo, and lettuce. We were told that the food would be a 30 minute wait, but we ended up waiting a good 1 hour and 30 minutes. The waitresses/workers never apologized for the long wait and we were never served the waters we ordered, just the beer. When the food came, I was disappointed to see that there were no actual crisps (the waitress told me after I complained that they were "cheese crisps", which I did not see). She also told me that I misunderstood what the menu said but it clearly said "crisps" and not "cheese crisps". Also the chicken was dry/slightly burnt and the salad was drenched with sweet vinaigrette, not garlic mayo at all. I'm giving 2 stars because I appreciate the history behind the place and my friend liked his beer, but based on the service and my chicken dish, I would not come back again.

rTSnUX5ok_aOC7gHhFNNTQ.text: Fantastic! Friendly staff, excellent choice of beers, always very good food. Can't fault it. Easily the best pub in the area.

UYG_nefjr3-WSHtdy2qbMw.text: Very welcoming place - sign up on the website for a free drink.  Not a big selection of drinks but some nice cask ales and wines available.  We sat at a small table downstairs and enjoyed drinks and dessert.  The sticky toffee pudding is a nice size sponge cake added with caramel sauce and cream, and my wife got a nice sized chocolate brownie with ice cream.  Check out the upstairs if you get the chance - a very cozy library room.

8mx3BHS7aTe_l6N0Grwdkg.text: My family and I went to Victoria on our first Sunday night in London. I had researched it in advance as an authentic pub for Sunday roast, the traditional Sunday pub dinner. As with most pubs you order food and drinks at the bar and they bring them to the table. It has a very authentic feel with mostly locals. The bartender was very attentive and didn't make us feel uncomfortable as Yanks. We started by sitting outside and had our appetizers before the sky opened and it poured. We had to move inside to the upstairs room.  We sampled three beers (London Pride, Oliver's Island and ESB) and had the smoked trout (7 pounds) and chicken satay (5 pounds) apps. The smoked trout had raisins and a fruit puree which I thought was too sweet. Something with a little acid would have been better. The family all had fish and chips (13 pounds) while I had the Sunday roast (16.50 pounds). Unfortunately my roast beef was very tough, a real disappointment. My family all liked their fish and chips though. Total with drinks was 93.75 pounds. About $150 at current exchange.

NHNki6rkP3j9c9rgcArgHw.text: Food and atmosphere was really nice! I looove the library bar! But unfortunately got sick an hour later after eating here :(

i9dhZ7irBvYdK604A4Cecg.text: My wife and I had heard about London's legendary Sunday roasts so we were excited to experience it for ourselves. Seeing this establishment recommended in PaddingtonNow magazine, as well as its many rave reviews on Yelp and Google, we decided to give The Victoria a chance to shine.Everything leading up to the meal itself went swimmingly: we visited them on Saturday to reserve a table and the server offered to have the kitchen set aside the roast beef and lamb for us. Sunday evening came and sadly the experience devolved into a massive disappointment the moment we took our seats. My wife's roast beef was overcooked to a leather-like texture. The potatoes, supposedly roasted in duck fat, featured thick, dry crusts that we could barely cut into with our dinner knives. My lamb was tender but the Yorkshire pudding was burnt to a blackened top. The fact that it even made it onto my plate showed either a blatant lack of attention, an indfference for quality, for both. Hilariously, when I pointed this out to a server, he nonchalantly offered "Well, would you like me to get you another one?" (Oh no, I'm obviously content eating this miniature bowler hat, thank you very much.) He also observed that we had not received our standard gravy on the side, which truth be told was sorely needed to rehydrate the tough sod on our plates.Despite our advance reservation and notice, my guess is that the kitchen just set aside some lunchtime roast leftovers, tossed them in the oven when we arrived, then set and forgot them on broil for too long. The food was lazy, insincere, and boring, which would be acceptable at McDonald's but not here at £17 a head. And if it's any indication, we watched the table next to us order steak and sausages - they ended up sending their food back three times before giving up and leaving.But what about the service? In a nutshell, aloof and less than adequate. Our server walked by our table no less than four times without checking if we needed anything when we were clearly waiting for the bill. She almost overcharged us by mucking up the math. And just as we were ready to take our leave we witnessed another server spilling red wine all over an adjacent table of five. The comedy of errors was finally complete.Honestly, I understand. This is a historic location with a colorful list of noteworthy patrons. The decor is charming, the atmosphere cozy, and it's probably a perfectly decent watering hole. But word to the wise: stick to their drinks. As it stands, this pub's namesake Queen Victoria would be thoroughly embarrassed by the kitchen and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Burnt Yorkshire, tough potatoes, dry roast beef (not pictured.) Yum.

2lYm776n7zfAYi2DNx225A.text: A lot like many pubs. However the food was surprisingly good - prepared well. I had a steak, ale, and mushroom pie, and would order it again.

E2Ewn4zTyz2mnzrI1K_PxQ.text: Classic pub, great indoor / outdoor seating. Haven't been upstairs or eaten here (yet)

WWsDNEymzm1fMXZSZnzSWA.text: If you've never been to London and never visited a pub, you might envision in your head this idyllic Victorian-style place where the neighborhood gathers, they offer great home cooked foods and a pint of your favorite ale.  When I walked into my first London pub, I realized that what I had in my head and what reality offered were two different things.Then I walked into the Victorian ... A charming, cozy neighborhood pub just off Paddington Station - felt like I walked into an ideal rendition of what a pub looked like in my head rather than to a real pub.  Wallpaper, crowded seating areas, the aura of ale wafting in the air, friendly bar staff and a hearty British/Euro menu.  The fact that there's not a lot of seating and the quarters are a bit cramped really added to the experience rather than detracting from the experience.If touring through London in the Paddington area and want to "experience" a pub - this is a great option.

n8cSx_btWOa6WWXZLMPkog.text: Historic Pub with excellent British pub food and good service. If you want a true British dining experience that is more family suitable than many pubs with TVs, walk in the steps of British history and definitely consider The Victoria. Cheers

LSpGKff8QWC_6W3gBIKirQ.text: Great atmosphere, cozy, fireplaces, old pictures and knick-knacks.  I could see why others would think library, but it reminded me of someone's living room.  Good beer list, a lot of Fullers as expected, but I liked it.  Excellent food. Get the scotch egg... don't worry what it is, just get it!  The cauliflower pakoras with curry dipping sauce were great too. Solid job on the burger and the vegetable curry.  And the fish and chips was probably the best we had in any pub on our trip. Seemed to be mostly a locals crowd, with a few tourists and families like ours. I wouldn't say the reception to us was overly friendly, it was more like we were tolerated, but that's OK.  It was a busy dinner rush, Euro cup soccer was on the tube, and I think that explains much of it.All in all, if you're looking for an English pub meal this is a good one to choose. Even better if you happen to be staying near or passing through Paddington station, but it might just be worth the trip even if you're not.  It made an excellent comfort food meal on our last night in the UK.

9wK40-i-mBrbnfwWH0xz1w.text: We stopped in for a beer and something to eat, as the reviews for this place were really good.  We were not disappointed at all.  Our server suggested their own lager (Frontier), and we ordered the fish & chips (of course).  The service was fantastic (cheerful, attentive, but not overbearing), and the beer & food were worthy of a repeat visit.  The lager was truly one of the best that I've had, and the fish was flavorful and cooked with a crisp, light batter.The place itself is very charming, and was filled with locals which added to the ambiance and authenticity.  We will definitely be back, and just wish our stay here was a bit longer.

j0niXlB6eg9QnQMglmp4Vw.text: This place was Awesome! We got delayed and had to move our reservation from 6:30pm to 9:30pm. The kitchen closes at 9;30pm. When we heard that we were bummed but wait! xz-33ZF_jDCPGeOSHEidWQ.text: Beautiful pub just off Hyde Park. Great drinks and great food. Always good for a Sunday roast. It's the best looking pub in the area. Never disappoints. Doesn't get much sunlight but the road it is on is quiet.

vuI4pJ3cJUNUVAa5S--JEQ.text: Came here for the food the other day, very disappointed because of the bartenders. After sitting down with wife, couldn't get any bartender to order any drink or food. They are all occupied by the single ladies or gents that came in after us.Skip this place if you just want food.

H6_FHAFcKxNBhCNxneOEXg.text: A good night outThis is really a classic pub like you would imagine. Location is on a more quiet corner, but near Hyde Park / Victoria Gate.We chose this place based on good feedback online and the fact that it's dog friendly (even inside). We came here on a saturday and naturally the place was full, inside and outside. But about only 20mins or so we were able to catch a table inside.It is a lovely pub. Lots of wood, a bit dark....nice interiour. Exactly the way we like it. The menu was interesting, having some of the old classics, but also some innovative choices. We ordered Scotch Eggs (Black pudding version), Calamari Rings and a Chorizo Burger....and some pints.Service was fine, quite busy of course. The Calamari Rings were good, crispy. Scotch Eggs were really good, nice twist with the Black Pudding outside. A bit too well done inside - but that's a hard thing to get completely right. The Burger was - let's say - interesting. Making it out of or with Chorizo sausages is a great idea. The flavour was really good I gotta say. But sadly it was a pretty dry burger. Some fat, some meat juice was missing. But at 10£ including a pint a steal!All in all a good dinner in a really wonderful pub. Not the very best ever, but a good choice.

dvqaGtpRevksSaVSu4v0hQ.text: This is a favorite of ours!  Authentic English pub with a great atmosphere and beer!  This is the 3rd time we have visited and it is a treat.  Friendly staff, great food and great location near Paddington station.  The fish and chips are a treat!

mk0obK1CKeK0Z8D-Z3RHcg.text: Been to this pub a couple of times. Not too noisy and a good place to meet if you're near Marble Arch. The food is typical pub food and well done.

Y5AbBmVRxtz3t554QpBbkQ.text: As advertised. Had fish and chips and a couple local beers / ciders. Absolutely delicious. A must see when visiting.

0zYMIXcmO40dFFIFF8NkIg.text: I was surprised to find mostly a pub with food, but a nice pub at that. Maybe I just have fish and chips on my brain, which is quite possible, but I expected more of a restaurant feel. Of course now that I flip back through the reviews I see pub, pub, pub.  So, I enjoyed the pub... had beer at the bar with the local crowd which was a pleasant experience. The menu does have fish and chips but it didn't really feel inviting for a solo diner to sit there and have a meal in the early evening when I stopped by. I hope to make it back for the fish, as the previous exultations of the fish  and chips seem quite credible.  It's a short walk from Paddington station and worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Here's a peek at the menu next to the local favorite, London Pride, a pretty typical English ale.

cBAKp5jeoOhqNpxx789Vaw.text: I made reservations weeks in advance to securely obtain a spot at this place, with no knowledge of the popularity of the place. We had a reservation for 19:15, which I already accounted for delays as we plan to eat at this place after landing at London Heathrow. However, customs took longer than usual and we ended up 40 minutes late. However, they were nice about it and still saved a spot for us, even though in the email it says that they will nullify the reservation if you are 15 minutes late unless you call. I called but no one picked up, so I emailed them, but regardless, I guess they got the memo.Note to Americans or others who are not used to the structure of a traditional English restaurant: I learned it on the spot but it was a bit difficult. There is a lower level seating that is crowded with lots of people waiting outside to get in. I sort of waited a few minutes and tried to locate a person to let them know I have a reservation, but I see no one except the bartender. That lower level seating is a bar and for those with no reservations. The upper level seating is the "restaurant," and a server asked us if we had reservations and I said yes, so she showed me to our table. I noticed that there is a chalkboard that said that the restaurant is fully booked, which means we unexpectedly stumbled upon a popular establishment in London!The ambience is amazing, but I guess it's because it's different from the typical minimalistic ambience in the US. This has a more classic, old-school ambience which gives a more welcoming home-like feeling. There were even books that had actual texts just behind where we sat! This is the first introduction to official British food and I really had a great first impression. We got the octopus appetizer and it was so soft and chewy. It is definitely very fresh and complements well with the oil and potatoes. I sampled my brother's fish and chips and I got the sausage with mashed potatoes. Both dishes were great and not overly salted. Service was a bit slow, but I guess because most European countries do not mandate tips, I sort of expected it. However, they had a button/switch where you can press to request service, which was a plus, despite the fact that I had to press 2 times to have a server come to us.

WYeHBYUfF-rIKIhXfL93Pg.text: First of all I would like to express my thanks and gratitude to fellow yelpers who's reviews let me to discover this little gem in the heart of London. In the mood for authentic English food I browsed yelp, then checked the menu, the price location and everything about this just seemed right.The restaurant, although reasonably priced had a nice formal and beings with stiff white cotton napkins starched stiffer than the British upper lip greeted us. The waitress was extremely friendly and helpful, although the service was slow and the restaurant could do with a little extra help but she was pleasant and courteous running around to serve all her customers. I ordered the meat pies which looked small but was incredibly filling and decadently delicious. Everything was simply perfect. Just a word of caution to fellow yelpers, the restaurant does get busy and they do not have adequate staff so please be a little patient. It is worth it. A tip, they have two mills on the table which in North America be mainly used for getting freshly crushed pepper. However, in this case, one contained salt crystals while the other contained pepper. I mistook the first salt Mill to be the Pepper Mill and accidentally over seasoned my food. If the owner or manager is reading this review, kindly label your salt and pepper mills appropriately. All in all a great experience and on my list if I visit London again

LIrfRzW7jM9_LYGvkyLq-g.text: This place is just Awesome!!! After Yelping something for lunch this places popped up with great reviews and we decided to stop by. First off the atmosphere is just what you hope to find in a London Pub. This place was beautiful and full of history! The staff were very friendly and made us feel like we were one of the locals. I ordered the Banger and Mash which was just delicious! The sausage had a great flavor and the mashed potatoes were light and fluffy. My brother had the fish and chips which was delicious as well. The fish tasted fresh and the flavor was just spot on. Both plates had great sized portions as well. For beer choice I had the Frontier and my brother had the Guinness. Highly recommend the Frontier for a nice refreshing taste! Overall this place hit the spot! Great food, great service and a great place to relax. Can't wait to come back next year when I'm in London!

We took the Heathrow Express to Paddington (15mins) and we got to get out and explore.... Its an easy walk from the Station..  I'd definitely go there again!

Tkm2LNABmv1EDyjZqHziJQ.text: Best meal I have at London so far. I ordered the Caporal Jones Sausages and it was delicious! It was reasonably priced and good flavors and quality. I would definitely come back again next time I am around Hype Park.  Love it so much that I went back the second time before I left. I had the Garlic Mushroom, English breakfast tea, and the toffee pudding with a scoop of ice cream for dessert. The garlic mushroom came with an egg and brioche and so delicious. the toffee pudding had just the right amount of sweetness and nicely balanced with the ice cream. Yum!

rAFi-PpwxAh5gDwFKM_22g.text: Travelling in London for a few days and decided to stop by for lunch.Ordered everything that looked good on Yelp review pictures, and everything was good indeed.Starters: Honey mustard mini pork sausage, calamari. Both were neatly made and presented. Calamari was thin, but in a very good way, that you're not eating a large ring of squid which can often be greasy.Main: Wild mushroom and egg on brioche, steak (not on regular menu). I ordered the steak medium but it came out more of a medium well, but it was the only part of the meal that I did not enjoy. All the complementaries for the steak: sauce, tomato, mushroom, and chips were good. Only had one bite of the mushroom on toast, it was also pretty good.Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding w/ caramel ice cream. This was amazing and to die for. Very spongy pudding; every spoon was just satisfying.Overall: 4.5/5I wanted to round it down b/c of the steak but giving a 4/5 would actually bring down the ratings of this place, and that would be a shame. Definitely recommend giving this place a visit; one of the best meals that I've had in England.

UGrwVR1wAMytcdDlvyxYNQ.text: The interior gives it a true Victorian style where the house Iredell was made in the 1800's.  You can easily find yourself lost as you make your way through the entrance passing each room with its own unique setting to a winding staircase.  I ordered the Cajun Blackened Salmon and a Guinness.  It did not give off the taste of a Cajun spice or taste however, it was moist and still savory.  The greens along with potato cuts were a good compliment.

B2_2pkQtHSuR1wlsyjxwTA.text: Stopped in for a drink. Not sure if this is an authentic British pub, since it seemed like most of the patrons had non-British accents (mainly American), but it was still a nice place to stop for a break. I've heard that London/UK is known for their warm beer, which was true here. But other than that, no complaints since I was only here for a short while and for one pint. So while I can't say anything about the food, would deffo recommend a drink or two.

LqhFsbJ9u0In2Tzc2zv7Qg.text: Loved this place. We had the lamb burger special with a pint and the truffle Mac. Service was friendly, average and just right for a pub. The fact this was the first authentic English pub experience for my wife and I - I'm probably rating it higher. Cheers to the Victor-ian!

gWiz03NABpNic0EKJoyTqw.text: Landing at Heathrow late on a Saturday morning, I had two goals in mind: check into my hotel and hit a pub for pint and a plate of fish and chips. Once I made it through passport control, catching a train to Paddington and accomplishing the former was easy.I took a nice 10m stroll down to the Victoria, a cozy 19th century pub and neighbourhood institution. Walking in about a half hour after opening, the place had just a few others sitting down for lunchtime brews.That plate of fish and chips came with a massive plank of beer battered cod, a pile of thick chips, a small dish of mushy peas, and a bit of tartar sauce. The fish was straight from the fryer hot, with the moist, flaky cod surrounded by perfectly crispy (and just greasy enough) batter. The chips were good, though nothing out of the ordinary, but definitely improved by a few splashes of malt vinegar. Washed down with a London Pride, this was a proper way to start a trip in the UK

photos.caption: Photo of The Victoria - Paddington, London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips, mushy peas, and a pint of London Pride

7H0oYu8hlSR_O55jkFeFvA.text: Great Fuller's Ales on the pulls. The staff is friendly and helpful the décor is comfortable and cozy. It even has a fire place. They serve traditional English pub food (I only drank her). It can get packed at times and a bit load but after a few pints you get load too. The clienteles are old, young, locals, and tourist. But most people stay to them self; no too social. But still a great pub.I will step in for a few pints next time I am back in Paddington!

NCU_ImG4WgTCUycZMILktQ.text: The food was fine. A few issues are listed below. There was a dish we ordered but were lactose intolerant. There was no listing of cheese on the menu, but the food came covered in cheese. This was disappointing. There was no indication to ask or specify. We also ordered the rabbit, venison, Cesar salad. The flavors just don't mix. Te fish flavor of the dressing with the game flavor of the rabbit and the mild tones of venison just clashed. On top if this, the rabbit was not adequately deboned. Lastly, the fish and chips were some of the more bland fish and chips that we have had in London. Definitely not the item to order here. Perhaps beer is the reason to come here, but if you are hungry, consider going elsewhere.

A8lOwShQfKtqdoTXjzT-lA.text: Stopped in on an early Tuesday evening. The pub had maybe 10-15 patrons. Interior decor is amazing and there's WiFi that can be connected to nearby. Fish and chips was super fresh and crisp. Service was quick and courteous. London pride ale tasted sort of like an IPA. Overall good experience.

Good food, though I normally hit Noorjahan across the street for a curry after a nice session.  Nice crowd too that's usually up for a conversation as well...

h7zq12jPjMBfSNxAjj0eMg.text: Supposedly Charles Dickens used to write some of his novels in one of the function room upstairs. It's the perfect place celebrate Fridays by drinking one too many honeydews and then finish with good dinner.  However, my one gripe:  it's very popular, not big enough and gets packed pretty fast.

3xhBBPPqyxZkgOdGwrvnUw.text: Delicious! The vibe in this place left me feeling like I had just eaten dinner in Sherlock Holmes' library. The Ham "pot pie" was great, the Scotch Egg spot on and the fish and chips looked great. Plenty of beers on tap, though mostly Fullers brands.

YMCmPcFCJKkuONdWqedCFQ.text: The Victoria is an excellent pub. It was recommended by a friend who is a pilot with United. Very friendly staff with very good food. Chris the GM is very engaging. The fish and chips were perfect. They make their own tartar sauce which was obvious with the first taste. Victoria is in a nice part of Paddington. If you want an excellent pub experience in London, I would give Victoria stop.

kzrrcLAOiQ5NNLAEEs1m2A.text: lovely inside decor, locals that smile back at you ... and a warm atmosphere that will cozy up any chilled breath!The pub is historical and famous for the right reasons! Don't leave london without experiencing The Victoria!

WUtnhLXGetcPtMMvkW3KCw.text: Super fun, moderately priced drink (hard to find in Hyde park area, lol) courteous staff, good music. I had a blast. I will

kxvfqDMGU-aV72pwTdKqbQ.text: This is one of those pubs worth a visit for the interior alone. The main ground floor bar (originally divided into Public and Saloon Bars, but now one bar) is an amazing example of a High Victorian interior, with acres of polished wood, two impressive fireplaces and mirrors decorated with an intricate fleur-de-lys pattern. A clock on the wall is dated 1864, although the area was built in the period 1830-40. Upstairs are two rooms (both available for hire): the Library is like a room in a private house, with wood panelling, a large decorative fireplace and classical Georgian detailing - broken pediments, scallop-shell recesses, and is cosy and intimate. The Theatre Bar is an extraordinary room, with a painted ceiling, heavy drapes over the curtains and white wood and gilt detailing. Much of it apparently came from the old Gaiety Theatre on the Strand. It is owned by Fuller's, and serves their real ales as well as highly regarded food (though I've not eaten here). I tried a pint of Fuller's IPA - not always easy to get - which was malty for an IPA, and at 4.8% pretty strong, too. The men's toilets are down a steep and windy staircase, with narrow steps, so be careful how many pints you have before descending

twh4-RtQWNW2mjp2zbrhuA.text: This is my London SPOT. I've stayed twice at a b&b just down the street and I love going to the Victoria. It was the first pub in London I'd been to and continues to be one of my favorites. My friends and I sometimes talk about how we wish we could take the Victoria and plop it down in Manhattan. The decor is everything you hope a London pub to be- cozy, historical, and lots of little corners you can just disappear to. The food is good and I'm a big fan of Fuller's so the beer selection is great.They seem to get a good amount of both tourists (due to the fact that it's close to Paddington Station and there are tons of b&bs in the area) and locals. I've had conservations with people who live in the neighborhood and fellow visitors like myself from all over the world. People are definitely chatty here, which is cool. The bartenders are always really friendly too. I've noticed it definitely does get busy even on random days of the week like Mondays or Tuesdays but if you can get in and get a seat, it's well worth it.

cap8xF7TU0vyr-ZxxNVcIw.text: Loved this Victorian style pub- hands down best service I have experienced in a London restaurant. We sat at the bar as it was packed during dinnertime and there were no seats. The bartender was very friendly and recommended the elderflower water which I have never heard of, but tasted like a lychee flavored soda-refreshing. Another woman took our order and was very patient with explaining some of the dishes as we weren't familiar with British food.We ended up ordering the Irish Stew and Sausages w/mash. I did not like the Irish Stew-it was basically boiled bland cubes of meat with tendons all over it and potatoes. Personally, not my taste. However, the sausages were juicy and very flavorful. As a dessert we tried the Sticky Toffee Pudding which was my absolute favorite...warm and moist cake topped with a gooey toffee sauce and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yumm!  Throughout our meal, the bartenders and waitresses checked up on us to see if we needed anything. A bit loud but a great hangout place for groups and they have a large selection of beers on tap. Nice cozy fireplaces on the first floor and there's an upstairs 'library room' for private groups.

AgANnSSjcXHTdS0prwCU2w.text: when i am stressed out and unhappy in new york, i look out the window and envision myself at the victoria.a good local friend introduced me to this place when i was a student in london. went back 3x a week thereafter. its tucked away in a gorgeous neighborhood. i only have good things to say about this place. the interior decorating is enough to make even the angriest person light on their feet. quiz night was always fun. the food was DELICIOUS! took my visiting american cousins here and they all died and went to heaven. the honey beer was wonderful. the upstairs is gorgeous, always felt so scholarly up there. and the people, the people. good pubs attract good folk- and i can honestly say that every time i went here i made a friend. rollerblading groups, locals, tourists- everybody was friendly, polite & down to earth.a london pub-lover's must. I promise you wont be disappointed!!!!

8WEnctNo2jb-TyZT89Mhzw.text: Nice, small, very british. I came from Germany and it was the best place to be in London.Lovable and good eating. My favorite place in London. Very nice service and lots of charm.Well done!

uNGHW0QvffcT_4gNhBa8gA.text: (2009) First trip to London...we asked the hotel concierge where they suggest going for a pint and some good food. He of course suggested things close to the hotel, or in the hotel...places the hotel suggests. We interrupted him, apologized and said, "What we meant is...when you get off of work tonight, where would YOU go for a good beer and a good meal?" He directed us here. It was maybe a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel, and it was worth every minute. One of the things I love about London, is when we walked into the place, one of the servers said "just find a spot anywhere and we'll find you" - and they meant it. They keep track of the sections they work in with such detail - they know who comes and goes and they're on top of things. We found a spot at the bar and loved the ambiance, loved the beer, LOVED the food (I had fish & chips, of course. Boyfriend had steak & guinness pie)...they had a pub quiz going on that night - and even though we knew no one, many people asked us if we wanted to be on their team, since it was just the two of us. It was great in there...when we return to London, we'll definitely return to The Victoria!

XgHVdYymP2nIpzrV7t7UyA.text: Fish and chips, pie of the day, and the Scottish eggs are a must!!!!!!  Along with the pints of ale!!!  First meal in London and it rocked!

DoRyzzX8-OJFE1OiAa0m6A.text: This Pub dates back 160 years, and it shows in a very positive way. Great interior, while nobody can say how old really, certainly looks like most of it has been around for a very, very long time.The artwork of the mirrors behind the bar feels original, as do many other details. It is said, but no one can prove it, that people like Charles Dickens and Winston Churchill used to be regulars in their times. Beers are mostly variety of Fullers, but also of the inernational variety. I was drawn to a pint of Leffe which was great. I found the people at the bar extremely friendly while I was probably the only visitor not living around the corner. What hurts the wandering eye a bit are the aircondition boxes mounted to the ceiling, but then it is not a museum but a place where people go to enjoy a pint or two.

gI4E-pccSIFuw5chPFm7zw.text: Wonderful classic pub in Paddington.  Slipped in for a pint while I was in London for the night on business from the U.S. and wish I would have had more time and a chance to try the food.  Fantasic traditional interior, friendly bar staff and great outdoor seating...nice crowd too.

b1yAkelTqXhK7PByEEUjAQ.text: Beautiful pub just a few minutes from Paddington station. Lots of wood, brass, fireplaces, mirrors, detailed railings: it's a quintessential old-style city pub. Friendly neighbourhood feel, too. A gang of rollerbladers came in last night when we were there. Inside is close quarters, and watch your head, fellas, when you go downstairs to the toilet. There are tables outside on the pavement too. There are a range of Fuller's ales: I noticed London Pride, ESB, Discovery. Food was decent. I had a steak and Guinness pie, my mate had fish and chips.

lSvXHLxr3CUzeAFsuY6ZOQ.text: My very first pub experience when I visited London, and I was not disappointed. My friend raved about this place, and, coincidentally, it was a block away from my B&B. Very nice atmosphere, a mixture of tourists and locals. Bartenders were very nice. Excellent Fuller's beer on tap, and the food was delicious. I'll leave everyone else to describe the interiors, but it was nice! Dickens I am not, though he did write part of "Our Mutual Friend" there. Churchill purportedly got sauced there too. Whatever, it was awesome! Go!

UJO3CYanST44vLaV5uVtHw.text: Terrific Neighborhood PubIf you're looking for a British pub experience, the Victoria is a great place to stop. If you're already familiar with pub culture, and just looking for a drink, conversation and some great food, the Victoria is equally welcoming. The Victoria is small but cozy, with a terrific kitchen. Sunday night, as at many pubs, is roast night, and the meals are incredibly savory. I had the single best best turkey dinner of my life at the Victoria, with a small cube of stuffing that was so flavorful that my initial disappointment at only getting a small cube vanished immediately. The roast potatoes and green beans were equally delicious. The staff is friendly, as are the patrons; I've never failed to engage or be engaged in conversation when sitting at the bar. I'm told there's a second room upstairs, but I love the bar so much, I've never even taken a look!This is one of a handful of places that makes me long to visit  London.

Ke2TSy1AGY_JROugLgGjNw.text: I had a sunday roast. It was not anything special. But they did not charge lots of money.It was great view if you are on 1st floor.

Lq-XVU05cPKRgrMjemKUoQ.text: Excellent meal for our last night in London with the kids.  A beautiful Victorian-style pub with a great menu. Not your standard pub menu, which is refreshing. Very good meal and great service upstairs.

MK_KLq2_dZ3iJAQ3c1JaaA.text: This place has great food and service. I had the chicken and vegetable pie. It was fantastic.  There was a nice mix of locals and tourists.

DL-Mxy4fIYvRwXQf0Wi1LQ.text: Stopped here after a long flight and a visit to Kensington Palace. Food was tasty and provided a welcome, authentic  pub experience (full of locals at midday - you order your food at the bar). I had deliciously prepared sole and my husband had the rump steak. We were staying at the nearby Corus Hyde Park hotel so it was convenient.

BLCVpntAXoydGMMbw8AIkg.text: One of my favorite pubs in London! The atmosphere both inside and outside is great and the staff is incredibly friendly. They have a good selection of beers. They have a pub quiz every Tuesday at 9pm which is a lot of fun as well! Highly recommend.

kPKGbSsQ3BuAgo5Fl9z-ug.text: Based on Yelp reviews and a desire to have some good pub grub, we stopped by The Victorian twice over two days.  The first time, it was so crowded that there was no room for our party of 5, but I had gone upstairs and spotted a 5 top table seating two women who were about ready to leave.  When I asked the one of the wait staff about possibly waiting for that table, when he went up, he said there were no tables.  It turns out that in the minutes between my spotting the tables and the waiter ascending the narrow spiral staircase upstairs, someone had run up and was squatting on the table.  So we left and had Indian food at another restaurant closer to Paddington Station that night.  The second night, which was midweek and earlier in the evening, the situation was different.  While there was still no seating downstairs, there was a 5 top in the library, which appeared to be occupied by two women with 2 small girls who were playing on the couch.  They appeared to be done eating, so I had our group head up the narrow spiral staircase to take their places at the other 2 toppers until the women and girls left.  Once they headed down the stairs, we moved in on the dirty table covered with glasses of partially consumed juices and then wondered what to do next.  It took a while to spot buttons next to the table tops labeled "Press for Service", so we did.  These are momentary toggle switches so we weren't sure if they were working, but after a second press, and carefully listening for footsteps up the narrow spiral staircase, one of the waitresses came up.  We helped her clear the tables while she explained that we had to go downstairs to the bar and place our orders there.  The food would then be delivered when it was done.  She was obviously overly busy but did a good job once we got her up the stairs. As Americans, this seemed odd, but perhaps this is the British way, so when in Britain...We assembled our order and I headed downstairs with two of our party with the other 3 holding down the table.  I placed the order at the bar and we had to carry our own drinks, water pitcher and glasses up that narrow spiral staircase. However, by then, we had the library all to ourselves, and it was a very intimate setting for a quiet family dinner, where we could chat about what we each had found most interesting during our day at the British Museum.  When the food arrived, which took about 10-15 minutes, it was hot, well prepared, well presented and delicious.  We had ordered a meat pie, couple of burgers, lamb shank and chicken entree.  All were served with fresh veggies on the side or hand cut chips (fries).  They also had a good selection of beers and ales to choose from both on tap and in bottles.  In summary if you are a party of 2, and don't mind sitting at the bar downstairs, this place is the cat's meow for a British Pub experience, but for a larger group, this will take some strategy and planning to get a table, and don't expect much service if you end up going upstairs. While these upstairs rooms have a ton of charm and character, the staff have to negotiate an incredibly narrow and tight spiral staircase, which is one way traffic, and if you encounter someone halfway, someone's gonna have to back track either to the top or bottom landing. I would give the atmosphere, drinks and food 4 stars, but service 3 stars- which is as high as you will ever get in a true British pub.

rRqDj2ss_KHj-0rjGJiSPA.text: Spent two weeks travelling around Europe. Poland, Germany, Paris and London, and is it weird to say that this place has the best food? I don't drink, but I like eating. Lamb+Ham+Leek pie with mashed potatoes, veg and yorkshire pudding, with huge helpings of gravy. Loved it, loved it, loved it. Go for their specials, stay for the bubbly British pub atmosphere and the tireless staff who will win your hearts. Thank you for being a nice finish to a trip abroad.

V8TTKDWYZlihgeSfMYrgJg.text: Totally cool Victorian style (old pictures of Victoria everywhere) British bar. You order food md drink at the bar and when someone gets up from the bar or tables, you take a seat (no reservation or waiting list). The fish and chips was the best one I've ever had. Massive piece of fish cooked to perfection and excellent chips. Loved the ambiance. Will be back.

aPGITuWzdw6CC9I-Yytk_g.text: Fantastique neighbohood pub! Super friendly staff, good drinks,good food, what else could you want?  The fish and chips is great, so is the liver, lamb!

Z5tI73mUKtpv9Fz_3iLsEQ.text: Stopped by this upon the recommendation of yelp and had a pint.I wanted to try the food but was on a time crunch.  Enjoyed the architecture and decorations of the pub. Felt very cozy. The man behind the bar (who I assume was the owner) was very pleasant and friendly. I would like to go back to this place to try the food. Still surprising to see how packed a London pub can get a 1300 hours.

F0jHF7Ggsp-0r9VrkohMiQ.text: This is a lovely classy pub in Paddington, near Hyde park. Has a good range of tap beers and ales as well as the usual bar drinks. There is a lovely library bar/room upstairs, where apparently, Charles Dickons used to frequent. Has some seats outside too. It's not a noisy pub but not too quiet either.Food is pretty nice, Gastro style pub grub.It's definitely a more upmarket pub for the Paddington area (not unusual to see patrons with their oversized Gucci bags and their chiwawa or pug by their side). Defo recommmend if in the area.

p2NJKsa0g5NnwR57FIp6Jg.text: This is clearly a comfortable inviting spot to reflex, refresh, and enjoy a solidly competent meal. Staff members are extremely friendly and the patrons are welcoming as well. They do have a couple of bar rats that hang around, but the two we witnessed appeared to be little more than over-imbibing eyesores that drew too much attention from the chatty staff. The fish and chips were very tasty and the pork loin was awesome.

k_W1rPehFyKiFLqN6zQwjA.text: Outstanding fish and chips, cool pub environment. Full disclosure: I am not a fish and chips expert but I know good food when I get it. This place has a good pub atmosphere and a small but quality beer selection. The fish was large in size, so much so that we split an order. Not greasy and very crispy with light batter. Chips were also crisp and not greasy.  Would gladly dine here again had lunch here with my wife and 2 kids(ages13,10) but could see if we dined here later at night, might not be all that good for kids but lunch and early dinner  no worries

tPhiG3H_haVvOv7O13dgPw.text: We just happened to pass by this pub before going to dinner, and since we had some time before our reservation, we popped in. Maybe because it was Christmas time and a lovely evening - but the pub was so magical. It was so quaint and warm. Just the perfect spot. They staff was pretty friendly - nothing over the top, but just enough.We had some great beers on tap and of course some sticky toffee pudding. Wow. It was good. I'm obsessed with it and have to have it everywhere I go, and this was a good one.I've been to a lot pubs in my life, and this one, was wonderful.

y7qn4x_-HUodeEJla59OAw.text: After being in London for a few days, we asked a local which pub was the best in town. He immediately told me The Victoria. I have to agree! I really love this pub. It has delicious food and a wonderful atmosphere. The staff was extremely friendly and the menu also had a lot of vegetarian options which was nice for the vegetarian in our party. Try the sticky toffee pudding. It's incredible.

6w8ZGOHcIEEXYJmVAKfE9A.text: What a pleasant surprise!My pub-loving sister visiting from the U.S. gave us an excuse to try this charming and historical pub. We sat outside, but there are lots of sweet rooms inside, especially upstairs.  The service is friendly, if not necessarily prompt, and the food is delicious.  We tried everything from salad to sausage to pie to a sandwich.  I will definitely be heading back very soon!

IIDMoD9XriW9iUSsqGuIOQ.text: I'm going to give this place four stars becaus Eiffel the ambiance and great cider I had. The food -fish and chips and baked ricotta appetizer was ok (too greasy for my or my husbands liking)- but the sticky toffee pudding was moist and super yummy...the vanilla bean ice cream with it balanced out the richness and sweetness of the toffee. This place was packed at 6 with many locals and tourists. Cool place to hang if you're in the area.

5Y3Czt5MLdhd9Mj9_A2TaQ.text: Great little pub with good service and cosy interior. Food menu looks awesome but did not get a chance to try. Will go back for beer and food and ambience.

ZvGAKLXccixM5iwvZwo_Wg.text: I went to London in October 2014 and just happened to stumble upon this place with my boy friend and my sister. All the bartenders were nice and friendly and the atmosphere was great. we were tourists and they were super helpful on other cool bars that we could visit in the area. Over all this is a place I would love to go back to one day.

k9WEZIFnk14pR9z1D6RPTw.text: Great service. The owner of the pub was very friendly. He extended his kitchen hours for us so we could get an order in. The food was delicious and the drinks were reasonably priced.
